snippet: A nine-month inquiry determined that Billy Hunter failed in his fiduciary responsibilities and that the board of the union should consider replacing him.
abstract: Nine-month inquiry determines that Billy Hunter failed in his fiduciary responsibilities as executive director of the National Basketball Players Assn and that the union’s executive board should consider replacing him; inquiry, which focused on allegations of nepotism, conflicts of interest and potential misuse of funds, concludes that Hunter did not embezzle or steal from the union.
lead_paragraph: A nine-month inquiry determined that Billy Hunter failed in his fiduciary responsibilities and that the board of the union should consider replacing him.

headline.seo: Report Questions Actions of N.B.A. Union Chief Billy Hunter
headline.main: Inquiry Questions Actions of N.B.A. Union Chief, but Finds No Criminality
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Questions Actions of N.B.A. Union Chief, but Finds No Criminality
